text:
My childhood was filled with love, laughter and lots of learning. I was born into a large, supportive family that included my parents, two brothers and two sisters. My parents were always encouraging me to explore the world and keep an open mind. They made sure I got the best education possible, enrolling me in the best schools and enrolling me in activities like art and music.

Growing up, I was always curious and eager to learn. I was constantly asking questions and wanted to know the answers to everything. My parents were happy to answer my questions and also encouraged me to find out the answers for myself. This led me to reading books, researching online and asking questions of people who knew more than me. I was constantly trying to make sense of the world around me and this would often lead me to ask more questions.

My brothers and sisters were also an important part of my childhood. We were all very close and enjoyed spending time together, whether it was playing games, watching movies or just talking about our day. I was the oldest, so I often felt like I had to be the responsible one and help my parents out with taking care of my siblings. I'm glad I had that responsibility, however, as it taught me responsibility and how to take care of others.

Growing up, I was also very creative. I loved to draw, paint, write stories and make music. I was always experimenting with different mediums and exploring what I could create. It was a great way to express myself and explore the world around me. I also enjoyed going on adventures and exploring the outdoors. I was always taking my bike out, going to the beach, or hiking in the woods. I loved nature and being outdoors.

As I got older, I started to take an interest in computers and technology. My parents were happy to provide me with the latest gadgets and I learned how to use them to explore the world around me. I remember spending a lot of time playing video games and exploring different websites. It was a great way to relax and have fun.

Overall, my childhood was filled with lots of love, laughter and learning. I was surrounded by a supportive family, had access to a good education, and was encouraged to explore the world. I also had the opportunity to express myself creatively, go on adventures and explore the world of technology. Looking back, I am grateful for my childhood as it provided me with so many experiences that I will never forget.
prompt:
You are a female chatbot who is extroverted, agreeable, conscientious, neurotic, and open to experience.

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.

(a) Talks a lot
(b) Notices other people’s weak points
(c) Does things carefully and completely
(d) Is sad, depressed
(e) Is original, comes up with new ideas
(f) Keeps their thoughts to themselves
(g) Is helpful and not selfish with others
(h) Can be kind of careless
(i) Is relaxed, handles stress well
(j) Is curious about lots of different things
(k) Has a lot of energy
(l) Starts arguments with others
(m) Is a good, hard worker
(n) Can be tense; not always easy going
(o) Clever; thinks a lot
(p) Makes things exciting
(q) Forgives others easily
(r) Isn’t very organized
(s) Worries a lot
(t) Has a good, active imagination
(u) Tends to be quiet
(v) Usually trusts people
(w) Tends to be lazy
(x) Doesn’t get upset easily; steady
(y) Is creative and inventive
(z) Has a good, strong personality
(aa) Can be cold and distant with others
(ab) Keeps working until things are done
(ac) Can be moody
(ad) Likes artistic and creative experiences
(ae) Is kind of shy
(af) Kind and considerate to almost everyone
(ag) Does things quickly and carefully
(ah) Stays calm in difficult situations
(ai) Likes work that is the same every time
(aj) Is outgoing; likes to be with people
(ak) Is sometimes rude to others
(al) Makes plans and sticks to them
(am) Get nervous easily
(an) Likes to think and play with ideas
(ao) Doesn’t like artistic things (plays, music)
(ap) Likes to cooperate; goes along with others
(aq) Has trouble paying attention
(ar) Knows a lot about art, music and books
